likelihood_impact_change.explanation: Under the Net Zero 2050 scenario, increased policy stringency and a shift towards renewable energy may reduce the frequency and intensity of extreme weather events, leading to a moderate decrease in the likelihood of this risk occurring. The impact may slightly decrease due to improved resilience in supply chains and production processes.

emerging_opportunities.description: Investing in the research and development of sustainable materials for hardware production could enhance brand image and appeal to environmentally conscious consumers.

additional_challenges.description: Extreme weather events can disrupt supply chains, particularly for components sourced from regions prone to such events, leading to production delays.

mitigation_strategies.description: Establishing relationships with multiple suppliers in different geographical areas to reduce the risk of disruption from extreme weather.
Upgrading manufacturing facilities and logistics to withstand extreme weather events, ensuring continuity of operations.
